DOC.brief_summary: The INSIGHT pilot study measure force apply doctor chiropractic ( DC ) delivery specific , manually base chiropractic treatment participant low back pain .
DOC.detailed_description: Low back pain ( LBP ) well-recognized health problem . One common manual therapy available treatment LBP spinal manipulation ( SM ) , separate 2 category : High-Velocity Low-Amplitude ( thrust ) Low-Velocity ( non-thrust ) SM accord force-delivery profile . One commonly utilized non-thrust SM technique Flexion-Distraction procedure . Several study report manually applied force thrust SM ; however , force use non-thrust SM , specifically use Flexion-Distraction treatment still unknown . The result pilot study provide preliminary information treatment force sample size justification future full-scale trial , also ascertain feasibility study protocol patient recruitment method trial .
DOC.criteria: Able demonstrate necessary ability ( English language , literacy ) need provide inform consent without assistance another person ( e.g. , proxy , spouse , family member support person ) Selfreported low back pain ( acute , subacute chronic ) time examination enrollment Weight > 300lbs Spinal Pathology condition contraindicate study procedure compromise participant safety Inflammatory arthropathy involve spine ( e.g . Ankylosing spondylitis , Rheumatoid arthritis ) Spinal fracture past 6 month Other condition require referral ( e.g . selfreporting alcohol/substance dependence abuse , unstable spinal segment , cauda equina syndrome ) Pregnant plan become pregnant within next 5 week Unable tolerate study procedure safely Altered Mental Capacity Sensitivity adhesives use study Uncontrolled hypertension Comorbidity require simultaneous clinical management compromise ability deliver study procedure assess participant 's heath status pose schedule burden Retention legal advice seek healthrelated insurance claim Compliance concern ( e.g . schedule conflict , move quad city area , unwilling undergo require study procedure receive treatment study doctor ( ) ) Quebec Task Force Classification 10 11 : ( chronic pain syndrome , visceral/infectious source LBP )
